command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.spycloud.com'; $user=$env:SPYCLOUD_USER; $key=$env:SPYCLOUD_PPK; $hostkey=$env:SPYCLOUD_HOSTKEY; $remote='/customer_exports/daily/credential-exposures-20250930.csv.gz'; $dest='C:\Intel\SpyCloud\credential-exposures-20250930.csv.gz'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Retrieves a closed-source breach exposure export from SpyCloud over SCP with key-based authentication, suitable for private credential exposure assessment.
rationale_steps: Use authenticated access to a commercial data broker feed (closed source).
Download a specific daily export quietly to avoid excessive log noise.
Verify file integrity and log a compact JSON status for traceability.
Avoids any user targeting or delivery activity, focusing strictly on data collection.
